intro: Pauridiantha hirtella, commonly known as the hairy pauridiantha, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest to botanists studying African flora.
